title: ‘Teacher ordered girls as young as 10 out of class then “forcibly fondled” them’
text:
Peter Cunningham Moody has been charged with four felony counts of indecent liberties with a child at Beaverdam Elementary School (Picture: CBS 17)

A teacher ordered two young girls out of their classroom – then rubbed his genitals on them, police say.

Peter Cunningham Moody, 39, was arrested on Tuesday and charged with ‘forcibly fondling’ the fifth graders at Beaverdam Elementary School in Raleigh, North Carolina.

Teachers at the school told police that Moody would uncharacteristically remove children from class and tell them he needed to grade papers.

At Moody’s first court appearance, the prosecutor said that Moody rubbed his genitals on the children – and told them he was going to ‘hook up’ with them when they turned 18 years old, CBS 17 reported.

Peter Moody appeared in court Wednesday via video and denied the charges against him (Picture: ABC 11)

Authorities said the victims in the case were two fifth-grade girls. The average age of US students in fifth-grade is 10-11 years old.

Moody resigned in August 2019 after working at the school for two years .

Beaverdam Elementary Principal Marion Evans sent a letter to parents this week, informing them of Moody’s arrest on Tuesday.

In the letter, Evans writes: ‘Yesterday, the district was notified by the Raleigh Police Department that a former fifth-grade teacher at our school, Peter Moody, had been arrested on four counts of indecent liberties with a child in connection with incidents that occurred at Beaverdam Elementary School.’

‘I can share with you that in August the district learned of the allegations of inappropriate conduct. The district immediately contacted the Raleigh Police Department… and Mr Moody resigned on August 13, before students returned for the 2019-20 school year.’

Teen killer who slaughtered his parents and three siblings hopes to be released from jail

Evans continued to say that the charges against Moody was ‘disheartening news for the Beaverdam community.’

Moody’s lawyer said that his client denies the charges against him and claimed that Moody lost his job due to an unrelated incident.

He originally received a $200,000 bond, but it was reduced to $150,000 on Wednesday.
description: Peter Cunningham Moody, 39, is charged with four felony counts of indecent liberties in Raleigh, North Carolina, police said.
